page.title: 02FARM ON OSTWALDTWISTLE MOOR
page.content: The dairy farm we visited was owned by Mr. RATCLIFFE. He has many cows and bottles his own milk which he then delivers. The milk is pasteurised by heating it up and then cooling it down again before it is put in bottles. The farmland is used to grow grass which is cut and stored as silage for the cows to eat during the Winter and also grass for the cows to eat during the Spring, Summer and Autumn. Female calves are reared to produce milk when they are older but male calves are fattened up and sold to be killed for beef. A full grown cow costs about Â£700 and the price of the tractors used to pull the implements around the fields can be as high as Â£20000.Houses cost about the same !!!
